newsitem.title: UK: London tea auction sees good overall demand.
newsitem.headline: London tea auction sees good overall demand.

text.p: The London Tea Auction saw good demand for both landed and offshore types, the official tea report said on Monday.
Quality Assams sold particularly well with prices for Best Available hitting highs of 200 pence per kg while mediums were steady.
East Africans were fully firm and coloury mediums were up.
The 999-package offering of Kenyan and Ugandan offshore teas achieved firm to dearer rates, the report said.
The next London auction is on November 4.
